content.description: A random sample of 10 employees of a company was selected to estimate the mean one-way commute time for all employees at the company. The mean and standard deviation of the sample were 38 minutes and 6 minutes, respectively.
content.question: Assuming all conditions for inference are met, which of the following is the margin of error, in minutes, for a 95 percent confidence interval for the population mean one-way commute time?

choices.label: <math alttext="1.812 times the fraction with numerator 6, and denominator the square root of 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.812</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.833 times the fraction with numerator 6, and denominator the square root of 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.833</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.96 times the fraction with numerator 6, and denominator the square root of 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.96</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2.228 times the fraction with numerator 6, and denominator the square root of 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.228</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2.262 times the fraction with numerator 6, and denominator the square root of 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.262</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2.262 times the fraction with numerator 6, and denominator the square root of 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.262</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.2: Constructing a Confidence Interval for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
